The fact that it has no assertions isn't the problem. The test is
meaningle=
ss, assertions or no.

Instead:

public void testSomeThing() {
    fail("No=
t yet implemented!");
}

No framework, good or bad, can stop people from do=
ing silly thing. Your
example was a silly thing. Developers should not be s=
illy when they can
avoid it.

What about this test:

public void testSomeTh=
ing() {
    for (int i =3D 0; i < 1000; i++) { assertTrue(true); }
}

"See?=
 I have over 1000 assertions! I'm way ahead of you guys! What's your
excuse=
?!"

If you measure X and say, "More X is good," then all you get is more X=
.

Thanks.
